content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Facility
Located at positions around x=-16.0, y=-49.0 and x=-14.0, y=-49.0, this facility is responsible for producing iron plates. It consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at positions (x=-16.0, y=-49.0) and (x=-14.0, y=-49.0) which are fueled by coal.
- Multiple burner inserters positioned at (x=-13.5, y=-47.5), (x=-14.5, y=-45.5), (x=-9.5, y=-44.5), and (x=-14.5, y=-43.5) that are responsible for moving items between entities.
- A wooden chest at position (x=-13.5, y=-46.5) and an iron chest at position (x=-11.5, y=-44.5) for storing iron plates.
- Transport belts connecting these entities to facilitate the movement of items.

### Transport Belt Network
This network connects various entities to streamline the production process:
- BeltGroup connecting from (x=-11.5, y=-46.5) to (x=-9.5, y=-46.5) in the right direction.
- BeltGroup connecting from (x=-12.5, y=-44.5) to (x=-12.5, y=-46.5) in the up direction.
- Additional belts connecting various positions to ensure smooth flow of materials.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors with Inserters Waiting for Source Items
- Ensure that the inserters have access to the necessary source items. This can be achieved by checking the supply chain and ensuring that all necessary resources are available upstream.

### Errors with Insufficient Inventory for Insertion
- Before attempting to insert items into a furnace or other entities, verify that the required items are available in your inventory. Regularly monitor inventory levels to prevent such errors.

### Errors with Inserters Blocked by Items on the Ground
- Ensure that there is a clear path for inserters to place items into the destination. Avoid placing items on the ground where they can block inserters.

### Errors with Inserters Waiting for Space in Destination
- Make sure that the destination entity has enough space to accommodate the items being inserted. Regularly clear out or manage inventory in destination entities to avoid blockage.
